com.camerontec.catalys.core.crypto

Class Crypto

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.registry.Registerable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.core.crypto.Crypto
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IConfigurable, IRegisterable

    public final class Crypto
extends Registerable
implements IConfigurable
    This class encapsulates all the encryption/security code. In particular, it encapsulates the user's private key (for PGP or PEM encrypt methods) and shared DES key (for DES encrypt method).

    If you want encryption enabled, you should call setEncryptMethod specifying a valid encryption method.
    For example: 

     setEncryptMethod( Constants.ENC_DES );
   </blockquote>
    You usually don't need to deal with this class directly. Session objects are associated with an instance of Crypto when FIX encryption is configured and will initialize the encryption method accordingly.
    See Also:
    setEncryptMethod(int)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Crypto

        public Crypto()
        Create a Crypto instance associated with the default encryption engine. The default engine is CryptixCrypto.

      • Crypto

        public Crypto(IEncryptionEngine engine)
       throws CryptoException
        Create a Crypto instance associated with an instance of the given encryption engine.

        If engine is null, a default engine is created. The default engine is CryptixCrypto.

        Parameters:
        engine - Encryption engine.
        Throws:
        CryptoException - if there is a problem creating a default engine.

      • Crypto

        public Crypto(String encryptionEngine)
       throws CryptoException
        Create a Crypto instance associated with the given encryption engine name.

        Possible engine names are:

        • "cryptix" - Cryptix encryption package (default engine)
        • "null" - No encryption
        If encryptionEngine is null (not "null"), a default engine is created. The default engine is CryptixCrypto.
        Parameters:
        encryptionEngine - Name of encryption engine.
        Throws:
        CryptoException - if engine name is not recognized

      • generateSessionInfo

        public void generateSessionInfo()
                         throws CryptoException
        Not intended for use by application code.

        Generates (randomly) encryption initialization values.
        Used internally in LogonMessage when initiating a session.

        Throws:
        CryptoException - if there is a problem with the security package

        Not intended for use by application code.

        Used internally by Message object when calculating the message digest.

        Returns:
        Get the session key bytes. These form part of the session info.
        See Also:

      • getEncryptMethod

        public int getEncryptMethod()
        Returns:
        encrypt method. See FIX specification, tag 98, for valid encrypt method values.
        See Also:
        Constants

      • getEngine

        public IEncryptionEngine getEngine()
        Returns:
        the underlying encryption engine, used for implementation specific tasks such as setting key rings for the cryptix class.

      • isAutoInitializeCipher

        public boolean isAutoInitializeCipher()
        If true the encryption cipher should be reinitialized with each call to encrypt or decrypt bytes.

        Defaults to true.

        Returns:
        True if the ciphers are initialized on each call.

      • setAutoInitializeCipher

        public void setAutoInitializeCipher(boolean autoInitializeCipher)
        If true the encryption cipher should be reinitialized with each call to encrypt or decrypt bytes.

        Defaults to true.

        Parameters:
        autoInitializeCipher - True if the ciphers are initialized on each call.

      • isEncryptionEnabled

        public boolean isEncryptionEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if encryption is currently enabled. Will return true if the encryption method has been set to a valid supported value other than Constants.ENC_None.

      • isEncryptionInstalled

        public boolean isEncryptionInstalled()
        Returns:
        true if encryption package is installed.

      • logonMessageDecryption

        public byte[] logonMessageDecryption(byte[] data)
                              throws CryptoException
        Not intended for use by application code.

        Decrypts the given secure logon message data, returning the decrypted data.

        Used internally by the Message class when decrypting logon messages.

        Note:
        Logon messages are decrypted differently to other FIX messages.
        See the FIX Security application note on the FIX web site.

        Parameters:
        data - TBD
        Returns:
        TBD
        Throws:
        CryptoException - if the DES master key has not been defined or if there is a problem with the security package

        Used internally by the Message class when encrypting logon messages.

        Note:

        See the FIX Security application note on the FIX web site.

        Parameters:
        data - TBD
        Returns:
        TBD
        Throws:

      • setDesMasterKey

        public void setDesMasterKey(String hexString)
                     throws CryptoException
        Creates DES master key from hexadecimal string.

        If you expect to be using pure DES (Encrypt method 2) you must have set a master DES key that both you and the sender are aware of.

        If you will not be using pure DES, you do not need to set this.

        This DES master key is used to encrypt the randomly generated session DES key which both parties will use for encoding messages in this session.

        Parameters:
        hexString - an hexadecimal string
        Throws:
        CryptoException - if there is a problem with the security package

      • setMyPrivateKey

        public void setMyPrivateKey(Key newMyPrivateKey)
        If you will be using any methods involving private/public encryption, you need to tell Crypto your private key and the other's public key.

        You will encrypt the DES key that you propose with his public key, so that only he can decrypt it.

        You will use your private key to sign the message, so that he, using your public key to check the signature will be sure that the message came from you.

        Parameters:
        newMyPrivateKey - your private key

      • setMyPrivateKey

      • configure

        public void configure(IConfiguration configuration)
               throws ConfigurationException
        Description copied from interface: IConfigurable
        Apply the IConfiguration to this IConfigurable.

        This method is called by the configuration module in the server:

        • when loading the configuration at server startup (e.g. when reading the XML configuration file) and
        • every time we reload the configuration object corresponding to the configurable run-time object.
        The Catalys Server passes a reference to a configuration clone. The original reference is unavailable to the configurable object. The configurable object may decide to store the reference as the last valid configuration object which can be used to optimize the re-configuration.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface IConfigurable
        Parameters:
        configuration - the immutable configuration object
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - This exception is thrown when the new configuration object cannot be applied to the configurable object.

      • getConfiguration

        public IConfiguration getConfiguration()
        Description copied from interface: IConfigurable
        Return the last valid configuration.
        Specified by:
        getConfiguration in interface IConfigurable
        Returns:
        Reference to the last IConfiguration used to successfully configure this IConfigurable.
